intro: Sideroxylon bonianum, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking red-orange flowers that appear in clusters. The plant has smooth, greyish bark and pinnately compound leaves with serrated edges. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it suitable for ornamental gardening. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its natural distribution.
